intro: Baseonema gregorii, commonly known as the Gregorii's baseonema, is a rare and unique plant species belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive basal rosette of leaves and its slender, flowering stems that rise from the center of the rosette. The plant produces small, white to greenish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It is native to a limited geographic region, primarily in the mountainous areas of South America. Due to its restricted habitat and delicate growth requirements, Baseonema gregorii is considered a vulnerable species in its native environment.
